# addMetadata(_:completion:)

**Instance Method**

Adds metadata to the sample.

## Declaration

```swift
func addMetadata(_ metadata: [String : Any], completion: @escaping (Bool, (any Error)?) -> Void)
```

```swift
func addMetadata(_ metadata: [String : Any]) async throws
```

## Parameters

- **metadata**: The metadata dictionary contains extra information describing all the samples created by the builder. The dictionary’s keys are all strings. The values may be strings, numbers, or date objects. For a complete list of predefined metadata keys, see [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/metadata-keys].

Using predefined keys helps facilitate sharing data between apps; however, you are also encouraged to create your own, custom keys as needed to extend the samples’ capabilities.
- **completion**: The completion handler called by the builder after it attempts to add the metadata to the series. The completion handler takes the following parameters:



## Discussion

The builder adds the metadata to the resulting series sample. It incorporates new data using [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableDictionary/addEntries(from:)].

## Adding Data

- **addHeartbeatWithTimeInterval(sinceSeriesStartDate:precededByGap:completion:)**: Adds a heartbeat to the series.
